title: Research Assistant
text:
000383 
About Anglia Ruskin University: 
Our vibrant, modern University is gaining prominence both nationally and internationally and we have ambitious plans for our future. Our main campuses in the cities of Cambridge, Chelmsford and Peterborough have been transformed with major capital investments. With an annual income of Â£190m and over 35,000 students, we are a major force for higher education in the East of England. 
About the role: 
An excellent opportunity has arisen for an intelligent soft system developer as Research Assistant to join the Anglia Ruskin Information Technology Research Institute (ARITI). You will focus on the research based intelligent software development, particularly in mobile/cloud based application domain. You will be expected to develop high quality intelligent research based software products with our commercial partners, and to write high quality conference and journal papers. 
With a degree in computer science or allied subjects, you will have a relevant software development background in one or more of the following areas: image processing, artificial intelligence, mobile computing, cloud computing, modelling biological systems, data mining, cyber security, video/image filtering etc. With excellent written and oral communication skills, you will be IT literate with a sound knowledge of Microsoft Office, and comprehensive understanding of intelligent modelling to the field of research. You will be encouraged to complete a PhD within your ongoing job. 
Please note: Interviews are expected to take place 5 November 2015 
We value diversity at Anglia Ruskin University and welcome applications from all sections of the community. 
Guidance Notes: 
For a list of key requirements, please download the Job Description and Person Specification via the apply link. To apply for this role please demonstrate how your skills and experience match the criteria in the person specification. Share this job
